question: Compare and contrast the major products of dehydrohalogenation of 2-chloro-4-methylpentane with **(a)** sodium ethoxide in ethanol and **(b)** potassium *tert*-butoxide in 2-methyl-2-propanol (*tert*-butyl alcohol). Write the mechanism of each process. Next consider the reaction of 4-methyl-2-pentanol with concentrated H2SO4 at 1308C, and compare its product(s) and the mechanism of its (their) formation with those from the dehydrohalogenations in (a) and (b). (**Hint:** The dehydration gives as its major product a molecule that is not observed in the dehydrohalogenations.)
